conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on sliders A and B on the inclined plane.
Slider A and B are connected by a rope on an inclined plane with angle 37 degrees.
Identify the forces on Slider A: Normal force \(N_A\), Tension force \(T\), Gravitational force \(mg\), Frictional force \(f_A\).
Balance forces on Slider A: \(T = mg \sin 37^\circ + \mu N_A\).
Identify the forces on Slider B: Normal force \(N_B\), Tension force \(T'\), Gravitational force \(mg\), Applied horizontal force \(F\), Frictional force \(f_B\).
Balance forces on Slider B: \(F \cos 37^\circ - T' - mg \sin 37^\circ = f_B\).
Substitute values for Slider A: \(T = mg \cdot 0.6 + 0.5 \cdot mg \cdot 0.8\), resulting in \(T = 1mg\).
Substitute values for Slider B: \(0.8F = 2mg\), resulting in \(F = 2.5mg\).
The magnitude of the external force \(F\) is \(2.5mg\).
